parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post mentions "Todoran Adrian," which, based on the provided data, appears to be the name of a person running for office. The post uses his name and image, directly linking the content to him. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The targeting data shows a significant reach across various age groups and locations within Maramureș County. This satisfies the condition of Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's message ("Fighting with all our STRENGTH for the Values of the Christian Family") and the use of hashtags like #vot (vote) strongly suggest an electoral objective. The visual element (assuming it shows Todoran Adrian) further reinforces this. The clear intention is to garner support for Todoran Adrian. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific viewpoint and candidate, making it promotional rather than journalistic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly crafted promotional message aimed at influencing voters' choices in the election. The use of paid advertising further emphasizes its promotional nature.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>389597150814992</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, a paid Facebook advertisement featuring Todoran Adrian, directly refers to a candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.  The message promotes his candidacy and explicitly encourages voting. The targeting data indicates a broad reach within Maramureș County.  While lacking a CMF number, the post's clear intent to influence voters' choices during the election period makes it highly likely to be considered electoral propaganda. The absence of a CMF number is not a definitive exclusionary factor, given the other strong indicators.  The post's visual element (assuming it's an image of Todoran Adrian) further strengthens the case for it being electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Todoran Adrian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Cyrila SRL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Cyrila SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 389597150814992), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura lui Todoran Adrian, folosind imaginea acestuia și un mesaj explicit de îndemn la vot ("Luptăm cu toate FORȚA pentru Valorile Familiei Creștine #vot"). Reclama, cu o cheltuială estimată între 1500 și 2000 RON, a atins între 150.000 și 175.000 de impresii, având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea lui Todoran Adrian.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie, conform articolului 98 t).  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile în Ad Library: contact@cyrila.ro și +40747635571.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
